intro: Couralia, commonly known as sea fennel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean and the Atlantic coasts, it thrives in saline and sandy soils. The plant is often found growing along the shoreline, where it helps stabilize dunes and prevent erosion. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in coastal botany.
